itemDescription: British hereditary peer and film and television producer

wikipedia_page.main: David Henry George Lascelles, 8th Earl of Harewood (born 21 October 1950), styled as Viscount Lascelles until 2011, is a British hereditary peer and film and television producer. He is a first cousin, once removed, of Queen Elizabeth II, a great-grandson of King George V and is 64th in line to the British throne.

link_mentions.page: List of earls in the peerages of Britain and Ireland

response: Alexander Edgar Lascelles, Viscount Lascelles (born 13 May 1980) is an English chef, and the third child and second son of David Lascelles, 8th Earl of Harewood, and his first wife Margaret, Viscountess Lascelles. He is a great-great-grandson of King George V and is 65th in line to the British throne. He is heir apparent to the earldom of Harewood, due to his elder brother having been born before their parents' marriage.
* David Lascelles, 8th Earl of Harewood (born 21 October 1950)
